children.title: C
children.description: C is one of the foundational programming languages used in the development of compilers, operating systems, and embedded systems where speed and efficiency matter.

children.title: C++
children.description: C++ is a high-level, general-purpose programming language.

children.title: C#
children.description: C# is a general-purpose high-level programming language supporting multiple paradigms.

children.title: CSS
children.description: Cascading Style Sheets

children.title: Dockerfile
children.description: Dockerfile

children.title: Elixir
children.description: Elixir is a dynamic, functional language for building scalable and maintainable applications.

children.title: Embedded Elixir
children.description: EEx stands for Embedded Elixir. Embedded Elixir allows you to embed Elixir code inside a string in a robust way.

children.title: Erlang
children.description: Erlang is a programming language used to build massively scalable soft real-time systems with requirements on high availability

children.title: Gleam
children.description: Gleam is a friendly language for building type-safe systems that scale.

children.title: Go
children.description: Go is a fast statically typed, compiled high-level general purpose programming language. It is known for its simplicity and efficiency.

children.title: Haskell
children.description: Haskell is a general-purpose, statically-typed, purely functional programming language with type inference and lazy evaluation.

children.title: HTML
children.description: HyperText Markup Language

children.title: Java
children.description: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

children.title: JavaScript
children.description: JavaScript is a programming language and core technology of the Web, alongside HTML and CSS. 99% of websites use JavaScript on the client side for webpage behavior.

children.title: TypeScript
children.description: TypeScript is a free and open-source high-level programming language developed by Microsoft that adds static typing with optional type annotations to JavaScript.

children.title: Lua
children.description: Lua is a powerful, efficient, lightweight, embeddable scripting language. It supports procedural programming, object-oriented programming, functional programming, data-driven programming, and data description.

children.title: Markdown
children.description: Markdown is a lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using a plain-text editor.

children.title: Nix
children.description: Nix is a tool that takes a unique approach to package management and system configuration.

children.title: Perl
children.description: Perl is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over 37 years of development.

children.title: PHP
children.description: PHP is a popular general-purpose scripting language that powers everything from your blog to the most popular websites in the world.

children.title: Python
children.description: Python is a high-level, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation.

children.title: Django
children.description: Django is a high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

children.title: R
children.description: R is a free software environment for statistical computing and graphics.

children.title: Ruby
children.description: Ruby is an interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language. It was designed with an emphasis on programming productivity and simplicity.

children.title: Ruby on Rails
children.description: Ruby on Rails (simplified as Rails) is a server-side web application framework written in Ruby. Rails is a model–view–controller (MVC) framework, providing default structures for a database, a web service, and web pages.

children.title: ERB
children.description: ERB provides an easy to use but powerful templating system for Ruby.

children.title: Rust
children.description: Rust is a general-purpose programming language emphasizing performance, type safety, and concurrency.

children.title: Shell
children.description: A shell script is a computer program designed to be run by a Unix shell, a command-line interpreter.[1] The various dialects of shell scripts are considered to be command languages.

children.title: SQL
children.description: Structured Query Language (SQL) is a domain-specific language used to manage data, especially in a relational database management system (RDBMS).

children.title: Svelte
children.description: Svelte is a UI framework that uses a compiler to let you write breathtakingly concise components that do minimal work in the browser, using languages you already know — HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

children.title: Swift
children.description: Swift is a general-purpose programming language that's approachable for newcomers and powerful for experts. It is fast, modern, safe, and a joy to write.

children.title: Zig
children.description: Zig is a general-purpose programming language and toolchain for maintaining robust, optimal and reusable software.
